members.name: overlaysWebView
members.description: Set whether the status bar overlays the main app view. The defaultis true.

params.name: doesOverlay
params.description: Whether the status bar overlays the main app view.

members.name: styleDefault
members.description: Use the default statusbar (dark text, for light backgrounds).

members.name: styleLightContent
members.description: Use the lightContent statusbar (light text, for dark backgrounds).

members.name: styleBlackTranslucent
members.description: Use the blackTranslucent statusbar (light text, for dark backgrounds).

members.name: styleBlackOpaque
members.description: Use the blackOpaque statusbar (light text, for dark backgrounds).

members.name: backgroundColorByName
members.description: Set the status bar to a specific named color. Valid options:black, darkGray, lightGray, white, gray, red, green, blue, cyan, yellow, magenta, orange, purple, brown.iOS note: you must call StatusBar.overlaysWebView(false) to enable color changing.

params.name: colorName
params.description: The name of the color (from above)

members.name: backgroundColorByHexString
members.description: Set the status bar to a specific hex color (CSS shorthand supported!).iOS note: you must call StatusBar.overlaysWebView(false) to enable color changing.

params.name: hexString
params.description: The hex value of the color.

members.name: isVisible
members.description: Whether the StatusBar is currently visible or not.
